definition: to think fondly of
variant of 眷[juan4]/to care about/to look fondly on
concern/wife and children

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: Your smile is my life can not forget her.
sentences.chinese: 你的笑容，是我今生无法忘记的眷念。

sentences.english: Youth look forward and age backward.
sentences.chinese: 青年人展望未来，老年人眷念过去。

sentences.english: Love, can arouse all of the fondly.
Permanent change, the mind has a right to feel nostalgic autumn.
sentences.chinese: 永久不变的，心中多了一份对秋的眷念。

sentences.english: He finds his hometown greatly changed .
I'd been with her about two years, and my heart was really in her.
sentences.chinese: 我与这艘拖船已经相处两年，对它充满眷念。
